Compositions

In order to graduate, every MIT student needs to have a concentration in some humanities subject like Literature, History, etc. While at MIT, I got my concentration in Music, which involved taking serveral music history and theory classes that made my head hurtâ€¦

My favorite music classes were Harmony and Counterpoint I and II where we learned some of the fundamentals of classical music theory. For each class, we had to take a piano lab, take a musicianship (sight-singing) lab, and compose a piece of music for our final project. Below are the two compositions that I made for my Harmony and Counterpoint Classes.

First Composition - Four String Quartet in ABA pattern

Second Composition - Theme and Variations for Piano
